item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 10, 2024 at 4:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. A good day to trie-hard: saving compute 1% at a time (99 points | 26 comments)
2. GPTs and Hallucination (20 points | 26 comments)
3. Debugging in the Multiverse (101 points | 28 comments)
4. Sapling: Source control that's user-friendly and scalable (29 points | 11 comments)

8. PR-Agent — extension that adds AI chat to code reviews on GitHub (9 points | 4 comments)
9. Memorizing the first 100 perfect squares (2022) (49 points | 22 comments)
10. Results (Don't) Speak for Themselves: A Case for Documentation (24 points | 4 comments)

14. Roame (YC S23) Is Hiring a Chief of Staff ( | hide)

25. Launch HN: Deepsilicon (YC S24) – Software and hardware for ternary transformers (170 points | 64 comments)
26. We're in the brute force phase of AI – once it ends, demand for GPUs will too (77 points | 95 comments)
27. B-Trees and Database Indexes (302 points | 62 comments)
28. Cecilia Payne-Gaposchkin discovered that stars are mostly made of hydrogen (110 points | 38 comments)
